nodes.bodyText: return
We should use the JsonFactory that comes from AppOptions

Note: Discussed offline and decided to use the default json factory here for local serializations. Added a comment
in code to clarify.
Why not just construct a TemplateResponse instance here and then serialize that via JsonFactory? Gson shouldn't be needed.
Good call! Updated the code to use Response types. Thanks!
This wouldn't be needed if we used the existing TemplateResponse and VersionResponse types to handle serialization.
Can be handled via ParameterValueResponse.
Should we throw a FirebaseRemoteConfigException here?
Add a comment here indicating that this is never set by the HTTP response payload.
Add newline at eof

nodes.bodyText: We no longer need this file. Removed.

nodes.bodyText: Good point! Thanks!
Can we assign TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC") to a class-level constant?
Use constants for pattern strings.
Make this a separate test case.
Split into multiple test cases
The example input doesn't really match the pattern. You might want to remove the fractional seconds before parsing the timestamp.
Moved the date string formatting to this util method and added comments to clarify the steps.
this(null)
I have to cast null to String here for this to work... this((String)null). Let me know if this is okay to use.
Use a local variable and split into 2 steps.
Add a comment here indicating why we need 2 zulu format strings.
Good call. Thanks!
Why not run assertEquals on the template instances?

Condition arrays are not quite the same for a direct equality check. The original template contains a condition that does not have a tag color. After the serialization -> deserialization process that tag color will be set to TagColor.UNSPECIFIED.
Should we fix that so the behavior remains consistent?
I think we should. Updated the code not to serialize the tag color as TagColor.UNSPECIFIED when null or empty.
This should happen before everything else.
Ah good catch! Thanks!
